title: Metro: A City's Lifeline
content: - Typically underground, but can also be elevated or at-grade.
- Designed for frequent, efficient passenger transport within urban areas.
image_desc: - A map of a city with a highlighted metro network.
narration: A metro is a lifeline for many cities, providing a fast and reliable way to get around. It's a high-capacity, rapid transit system, usually underground, but sometimes elevated or at-grade. Think of it as a dedicated network of trains designed for frequent, efficient passenger transport within urban areas.
